Funeral Quest Admin Help
What is Funeral Quest really?

FQ is a client/server based multiplayer game.  You run the server, anybody with a browser and Flash 5/6 plug in (basically everybody) is a client.

FQ is designed to be free for all players and a modest fee for the admin (you).  You are free to add banner ads, customize the game and run it how you see fit.

The server is a little .EXE that you run and leave running 24 hours a day.  It takes very little resources and players shouldn't notice a slow down even while you're using your computer to make MP3's or something else processor intensive.

It's simple to get started.  Run the .EXE.  There, your server is now up and people can play.

Click the "Logon Node 2" button. A browser window will open and you'll be playing FQ.  Cut and paste the URL at the top, give this to anybody you also want to be able to play.  Put it on your website and you're all set, just wait and watch the players roll in!

Being the system operator takes work, you have to make sure everything is running right, reboot after crashes (God forbid), answer emails from players complaining about cheaters.

Why subject yourself to this kind of thankless job?  Because it's fun!! It's kind of like an ant farm, see the society build from the perspective of the omnipotent. 

You can greatly customize your FQ game! Tons of the text can be editted with a text editor and also game logic can be added/changed with the robust internal scripting system.

Q. What's new in this version?

A. Check the history.txt file.

Q. Do I need a website to run FQ?

A. Well, not exactly. The server is completely self sufficient, it is a full featured web server as well as a game and serves its own files, pages, chat etc.  Having your own website makes sense because without one how will anybody know the URL to your game to play?

Q. Is this the demo or the full version?

A. Full version. FQ is now free to anybody.

Important links

www.rtsoft.com - home of FQ and the official public FQ forum

Scripting Help - Info on scripting your own story and changes into FQ

Joe Johnston's FQ page - Up to date FQ Scripting Reference, along with several mods like Bingo Night and Black Cat (broken url?)

Dan Walma's FQ Mod page - Includes several events and the Casino mod. (broken url?)

Funeral Quest Strategies - For players, learning FQ. (broken url?)

For support: Well, FQ is no longer officially supported. But RTsoft & Codedojo have forums so that's a good place to try.
